title: How to Make Yams

steps.headline: Poke holes in the yams.
steps.description: Use a fork to poke holes all over the yams, to let moisture and air escape while they bake.

steps.headline: Wrap them loosely in tin foil.
steps.description: This helps them bake more evenly.

steps.headline: Place the yams in the oven.
steps.description: You can put them directly in the oven or put them on a baking sheet.

steps.headline: Bake for about 1 hour.
steps.description: The yams are finished when they are tender when poked with a fork.

steps.headline: Remove the yams from the oven and let them cool.
Slice them in half and enjoy with toppings of your choice.
steps.description: Top them with butter, maple syrup sugar, cinnamon, or savory toppings like chives and sour cream.

steps.headline: Season the yams.
steps.description: Place the chopped yams in a roasting tray and toss them with oil, salt and pepper to thoroughly coat.

steps.headline: Make the syrup.
steps.description: Place a saucepan over a medium-high heat. Add the sugar, water, lemon juice, sherry, vanilla and maple syrup. Bring to a boil and simmer for 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside until the yams are done.

steps.headline: Test the yams.
steps.description: Keep checking on the yams, making sure that they do not burn on the bottom by turning them over occasionally. At around 20-25 minutes, test them with a knife to see if they are cooked. The knife should enter easily without resistance. At this point, transfer them to the oven-proof dish.

steps.headline: Add the syrup.
steps.description: Pour the syrup over the sweet potatoes and return them to the oven. Let them warm through, giving the syrup time to caramelize. This should take about 25 minutes. Finally, remove from the oven.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Your yams are almost ready for the table. All that is left is to sprinkle them with some toasted almonds. They will go well with turkey or ham.

steps.headline: Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Place the cubed yams in the boiling water.
Boil the yams until they are tender.
steps.description: Test them with a fork to determine when they are ready; they should be soft and fall apart easily when poked.

steps.headline: Drain the yams.
steps.description: Use a colander to drain the water from the yams.

steps.headline: Mash the yams with the cream, butter, and seasonings.
steps.description: Use a potato masher to mash the yams until they reach a smooth consistency without many lumps.

steps.headline: Add more seasonings.
steps.description: You can change the flavor of the dish by adding other seasonings like lime juice, maple syrup, or your other favorite flavors.

text: Baked Yams Preheat the oven to 350 degrees.  Poke holes in the yams. Use a fork to poke holes all over the yams, to let moisture and air escape while they bake. Wrap them loosely in tin foil. This helps them bake more evenly. Place the yams in the oven. You can put them directly in the oven or put them on a baking sheet. Bake for about 1 hour. The yams are finished when they are tender when poked with a fork. Remove the yams from the oven and let them cool.  Slice them in half and enjoy with toppings of your choice. Top them with butter, maple syrup sugar, cinnamon, or savory toppings like chives and sour cream. Candied Yams Preheat the oven to 400 degrees.  Season the yams. Place the chopped yams in a roasting tray and toss them with oil, salt and pepper to thoroughly coat. Make the syrup. Place a saucepan over a medium-high heat. Add the sugar, water, lemon juice, sherry, vanilla and maple syrup. Bring to a boil and simmer for 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat and set aside until the yams are done. Test the yams. Keep checking on the yams, making sure that they do not burn on the bottom by turning them over occasionally. At around 20-25 minutes, test them with a knife to see if they are cooked. The knife should enter easily without resistance. At this point, transfer them to the oven-proof dish. Add the syrup. Pour the syrup over the sweet potatoes and return them to the oven. Let them warm through, giving the syrup time to caramelize. This should take about 25 minutes. Finally, remove from the oven. Serve. Your yams are almost ready for the table. All that is left is to sprinkle them with some toasted almonds. They will go well with turkey or ham. Mashed Yams Bring a large pot of water to a boil.  Place the cubed yams in the boiling water.  Boil the yams until they are tender. Test them with a fork to determine when they are ready; they should be soft and fall apart easily when poked. Drain the yams. Use a colander to drain the water from the yams. Mash the yams with the cream, butter, and seasonings. Use a potato masher to mash the yams until they reach a smooth consistency without many lumps. Add more seasonings. You can change the flavor of the dish by adding other seasonings like lime juice, maple syrup, or your other favorite flavors.
